member.name: N:Microsoft.Dynamics
member.summary: The namespace contains the class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.AxaptaException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when an unexpected Axapta error has occurred. The class serves as a base class for several exceptions in the namespace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.AxaptaException.#ctor
member.summary: The constructor creates an instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.AxaptaException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The constructor creates an instance of the class by using the specified error message.
member.param: The error message that is used to create this instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.AxaptaException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: The constructor creates an instance of the class by using the specified error message and exception.
member.param: The error message that is used to create this instance of the class.
The exception that is used to create this instance of the class.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Dynamics.AxaptaException.errorCode
member.summary: The field contains the error code value for the object.

member.name: N:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet
member.summary: The namespace, along with the namespace, provides the .NET classes for the Axapta Business Connector.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.AlreadyLoggedOnException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when logon to Axapta fails because the user session is already logged on.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.Axapta
member.summary: The class provides the ability to connect to the Axapta system, create Axapta classes, create Axapta record, container, and buffer objects, execute transactions, and perform other Axapta system tasks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.Axapta.#ctor
member.summary: The constructor creates an instance of the Axapta class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.Axapta.Logoff
member.summary: The method disconnects from Axapta.
member.returns: The return value is true if the Axapta object was logged off after having been previously logged on, and false if the Axapta object was not previously logged on.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.Axapta.Logon(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The method connects to the Axapta system.
member.param: The language to use for Axapta labels. This parameter is optional and is used to override the corresponding parameter in the configuration being used. If there is no override value, specify the keyword null.
The company to activate. This parameter is optional and is used to override the corresponding parameter in the configuration being used. If there is no override value, specify the keyword null.

The name of the Axapta configuration to use while logging on. This parameter is optional. If null is specified for this parameter and Business Connector is being executed within the context of an interactive Microsoft Windows account, Business Connector will use the default configuration (maintained by the Axapta Client Configuration Utility). If Business Connector is being executed within the context of a non-interactive Windows account (such as the Business Connector Proxy AD user), this parameter is used to specify the path that points to an exported configuration file.

The Axapta Object Server to use for the connection. This parameter is optional and is used to override the corresponding parameter in the configuration being used. If there is no override value, specify the keyword null.
member.exception: An unexpected error has occurred with the Business Connector.
An argument passed to the method is invalid.
The requested operation cannot be performed because the user is already logged on to Axapta.
The logon failed because the logon parameters do not match those currently being used in Business Connector.
There is insufficient memory to complete the requested operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.Axapta.LogonAs(System.String,System.String,System.Net.NetworkCredential,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The method connects to MSDAX on behalf of a specific MSDAX user.
member.param: Name of the Microsoft Windows user to use to log on to MSDAX. Do not use the Axapta user name; use the NT alias that is connected to the Axapta account. This parameter is optional if you have set up your MSDAX user ID to automatically login to MSDAX. For example, ntuser.To use the current user, specify the null keyword for the bcProxyCredentials parameter.

The language to use for MSDAX labels. Used to override the corresponding parameter in the user options.For example, "en-us".If this parameter is not intended to be used, specify "" to indicate empty; optional.

The company you want to select for the session to which you will log on to. Used to override the corresponding parameter in the configuration being used.For example, "dat".If this parameter is not intended to be used, specify "" to indicate empty; optional.

Credentials of the Business Connector Proxy user used to authenticate and enable the use of LogonAs.For more information on creating a proxy user, see !!ShortCutSTART!!ms-its:AXInstallationGuide.chm::/html/3e46dc0a-2ff4-4a06-ae61-041e52dcc774.htm!!ShortCutMID!!Set the Business Connector proxy user!!ShortCutEND!!.You can create a NetworkCredential object with the following code:System.Net.NetworkCredential creds = new System.Net.NetworkCredential( ADUserName, ADUserPassword, ADDomain)The NetworkCredential parameters must match the Business Connector Proxy user set in the Business Connector Proxy dialog box: To verify your settings go to the Administration pane, click Setup, click Security, and then select BusinessConnectorProxy.

Name of the MSDAX configuration to use while logging on.For example, Business Connector Proxy Active Directory user.A configuration file can be used if you point to the physical axc file. To create an axc file, in the MSDAX Configuration Utility, click the Manage button and then click SaveConfigurationasfile. This will create a file with an .axc extension that can launch MSDAX.If "" is specified for this parameter and Business Connector is being executed within the context of an interactive Windows account, Business Connector uses the default configuration. This is maintained by the MSDAX configuration utility where the target is set to the local client. When executing Business Connector within the context of a non-interactive Windows account, Business Connector uses the default configuration where the target is set to Business Connector (non-interactive use only).An interactive account means you are using a client interface. Examples include running an application from Visual Studio or running an executable. A non-interactive account indicates that the process does not belong to a user Windows session or workstation.

The MSDAX Application Object Server (AOS) to connect to. Used to override the corresponding parameter in the configuration being used.For example, "Company1@AosInstance:PortNumber.To determine the Server Name, Instance Name and TCP/IP Port number, click the Start menu, click Administrative tools and then select Microsoft Dynamics AX 4.1 Configuration Utility. In the client configuration window, select the Connection tab. The Server Name, Instance Name and TCP/IP Port number AOS instance is displayed.If this parameter is not intended to be used, specify "" to indicate empty; optional. In a production environment, specify the port rather than using a configuration. This will assure that you are using the correct AOS. This is especially important when you have AIF, EP or batch servers that you want directed at a single AOS versus the AOS that the clients use. Specifying the port is a direct way of identifying the AOS to use.
The domain associated with the Windows user. This parameter is optional.For example, domain.corp.companyname.com.If this parameter is not intended to be used, specify "" to indicate empty.
member.exception: There is insufficient memory to complete the requested operation.
The logon failed because the logon parameters do not match those currently being used in Business Connector because of a previous logon is using that instance of the Business Connector.
An argument passed to the method is invalid.
An unexpected error has occurred with Business Connector.
The requested operation cannot be performed because the user is already logged on to MSDAX.
A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
The requested operation cannot be performed because the required security key does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.Axapta.LogonAsGuest(System.Net.NetworkCredential,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The method connects to the Axapta system as the Axapta guest user.
member.param: The language to use for Axapta labels. This parameter is optional and is used to override the corresponding parameter in the configuration being used. If this parameter is not intended to be used, specify the keyword null.
The Windows credentials for the Windows user who will act on behalf of the quest user being logged on to Axapta.

Name of Axapta configuration to use while logging on. This parameter is optional. If null is specified for this parameter and Business Connector is being executed within the context of an interactive Windows account, Business Connector will use the default configuration (maintained by the Axapta Client Configuration Utility). If Business Connector is being executed within the context of a non-interactive Windows account (such as the Business Connector Proxy AD user), then this parameter is used to specify the path which points to an exported configuration file.

Name of the Axapta Object Server to connect to. This parameter is optional and is used to override the corresponding parameter in the configuration being used. If this parameter is not intended to be used, specify the keyword null.

The company to activate. This parameter is optional and is used to override the corresponding parameter in the configuration being used. If this parameter is not intended to be used, specify the keyword null.
member.exception: There is insufficient memory to complete the requested operation.
The logon failed because the Axapta guest user has not been created or the HTTP context is not accessible from the .NET Business Connector.
An unexpected error has occurred with the Business Connector.

The requested operation cannot be performed because the user is already logged on to Axapta.
The logon failed because the logon parameters do not match those currently being used in Business Connector.

The requested operation cannot be performed because the required security key does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.Axapta.Refresh
member.summary: The method clears the internal memory cache, including the cached database information. This method is intended only for development use, specifically to have the object reread the Axapta application code without requiring a logoff/logon sequence. As clears the internal cache, it is not recommended that this method be called every time a user logs on to a Web site. Calling would greatly decrease the performance time of the Web site.
member.exception: The requested operation cannot be performed because the user is not logged on to Axapta.
An unexpected error has occurred with the Business Connector.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.Axapta.Session

member.returns: The return value is the ID of the session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.AxaptaRecord.DoDelete
member.summary: The method deletes the Axapta record. Calling this method resembles calling the doDelete member method of a record in the Axapta X++ language. Calling ensures that any Axapta X++ code written in the delete member method of the record is not executed. Calling always executes the Axapta X++ code written in the delete member method of the record.
member.exception: An unexpected error has occurred with the Business Connector.
An attempt has been made to access an invalid record.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.AxaptaRecord.DoInsert
member.summary: The method inserts the Axapta record into the database. Calling this method resembles calling the doInsert member method of a record in the Axapta X++ language. Calling ensures that any Axapta X++ code written in the insert member method of the record is not executed. Calling always executes the Axapta X++ code written in the insert member method of the record.
member.exception: An unexpected error has occurred with the Business Connector.
An attempt has been made to access an invalid record.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.AxaptaRecord.DoUpdate
member.summary: The method updates the Axapta record into the database. Calling this method resembles calling the doUpdate member method of a record in the Axapta X++ language. Calling ensures that any Axapta X++ code written in the update member method of the record is not executed. Calling always executes the Axapta X++ code written in the update member method of the record.
member.exception: An unexpected error has occurred with the Business Connector.
An attempt has been made to access an invalid record.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.AxaptaRecord.PostLoad
member.summary: The method calls the postLoad member method of the Axapta record. Whenever a record is read from the database, the postLoad member method of the Axapta record is automatically called. The postLoad member method of the Axapta record can be overridden in Axapta X++ to accomplish specific behavior.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.AxaptaRecordNotValidException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the Axapta record being referenced is not valid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.AxEventHandlerDelegate
member.summary: You can pass in instances of the delegate to MSDAX and they will be transformed into ManagedEventDelegate X++ objects, once they are in X++ you can call the invoke method to call out and execute the managed event delegate.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.BusinessConnectorException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when an unexpected error has occurred with the Business Connector.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.ConnectionLostException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the connection to the AOS is lost.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.DebuggerStopException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the Axapta debugger has been stopped.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.ExceptionErrorException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when an unexpected system exception has occurred.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.FatalErrorLoggedOffException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the Axapta session is closed due to an error.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.InitializationFailedException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the .NET Business Connector fails to initialize.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.InvalidReturnValueException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when a return value is invalid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.LogonAsGuestNotSupportedException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when trying to logon as Guest from a non-web (IIS) scenario, for example, directly thru .NET Business Connector.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.LogonFailedException
member.summary: The exception is thrown during an Axapta logon failure.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.LogonSystemChangedException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when logon to Axapta fails due to logon parameters not matching those currently in use for the Business Connector.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.LogonUserLockedOutException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the user attempting a logon is locked out due to exceeding the maximum number of logon attempts.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.MethodUnknownException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the method being referenced is not known by the system.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.NoIISRightsException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when logon to Axapta fails because the user has not been granted the proper IIS rights.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.NoSecurityKeyException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when a requested operation fails because the required security key does not exist.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.NotLoggedOnException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when a requested operation cannot be performed because the user is not logged on.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.PermissionDeniedException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when permission is denied to execute an operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.ServerCommunicationErrorException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when communication between the client computer and the server fails.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.ServerOutOfReachException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when communication with the server could not be established.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.ServerOutOfResourcesException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the server terminates the session due to the server not having enough free resources.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.ServerUnavailableException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the server is unavailable. Axapta will attempt to connect to other servers listed in the client configuration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.SessionTerminatedException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the server terminates the session.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.UnknownClassHandleException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the class being referenced does not exist.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.UnknownRecordException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when the record being referenced does not exist.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.UnknownTextException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when an unknown text exception has occurred.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.UnknownXPPClassException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when an X++ exception has occurred.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.BusinessConnectorNet.XppException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when an X++ exception has occurred.
